GTN Video Library

Below are video versions of the GTN materials, created for various events.

Note: Please be aware that these videos may use an outdated version of the tutorial. Please use the links to the archived versions of the GTN materials (below the video), to view the tutorials as they were at the time of recording.

Lecture & Demo

Description: The Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) global pandemic has had a profound, lasting impact on the world's population. Accurate and timely diagnosis of COVID-19 infection is an important step for providing care and containing its further spread. In this tutorial, attendees will be introduced to two workflows â€“ a) database search workflow and b) peptide validation workflow. Attendees of the workshop will get an in-depth knowledge of the Galaxy workflows that detect SARS-CoV-2 peptides ([10.1186/s12014-021-09321-1)](https://doi.org/10.1186/s12014-021-09321-1)) and co-infecting pathogen peptides ([10.1021/acs.jproteome.0c00822](https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jproteome.0c00822)).
Length: 35m
Captions by: Emma Leith
Created: 15 February 2021
Supporting Material: Slides, Workflow

Speakers

Timothy J. Griffin
University of Minnesota
Subina Mehta
University of Minnesota
Andrew Rajczewski
University of Minnesota
Pratik Jagtap
University of Minnesota
